definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Moses therefore took the money of them that were above, and whom they had redeemed from the Levites.
sentences.chinese: 梅瑟就为那超过肋未人数而应赎回的人，征收了赎金。

sentences.english: A follower of the bandit landlord Ko Tseng-chiang, he kidnaped people for ransom, stole goods and plundered land.
sentences.chinese: 他绑架诈取赎金，偷东西，还强占别人土地。

sentences.english: The robber abduct the heiress and hold her to ransom.
sentences.chinese: 强盗劫持了女继承人并向她索取赎金。

sentences.english: The kidnappers levied a ransom on the child's parents.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪向小孩的父母索取赎金。

sentences.english: Police confirmed that the money is Cooper's ransom to get the part.
sentences.chinese: 警方证实，这笔钱就是库伯得到的赎金中的一部分。

sentences.english: The teerist kidnaps prime minister and asks government for five million ransom money .
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子绑架了首相，并向政府要了五百万的赎金。

sentences.english: It was released in January after an apparent ransom was parachuted aboard the vessel.
sentences.chinese: 一个月后，在赎金用降落伞投掷到船上后，它被放回。

sentences.english: The ransom must proportion the losses we have borne.
sentences.chinese: 赎金必须相当于我们所遭受的损失。

sentences.english: However, there are news reports that a ransom was paid.
sentences.chinese: 不过，有新闻报导说，意大利支付了赎金。

sentences.english: Snow flying Jia Biao to take ransom, persuade put her little mountain and CAI core.
sentences.chinese: 雪飞趁贾标往取赎金，说服少山放了她和蔡芯。

sentences.english: He has demanded a huge ransom amount for the release, which Mr. Jiang cannot afford.
sentences.chinese: 他要求大量的赎金才肯放人，而江负担不起。

sentences.english: Not releasing Centurions for ransom does not lower player's honor.
sentences.chinese: 拒绝为赎金释放入侵军团的百夫长不降低玩家的荣誉。

sentences.english: Pirates are demanding multi-million dollar ransoms for both vessels.
sentences.chinese: 海盗对这两艘被绑架船只各索取数百万美元赎金。

sentences.english: They then mailed a ransom note to the Franks.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们将一张写有赎金的纸条寄到了弗兰克斯家中。

sentences.english: Some museums will pay a ransom to get the artwork back.
sentences.chinese: 一些博物馆愿意支付赎金将艺术品换回。

sentences.english: The police caught the man who tried to abduct the boy for ransom.
sentences.chinese: 警察抓住了那个企图拐走这男孩以便勒索赎金的家伙。

definition: lit. to tear the ticket/to kill a hostage (usually held for ransom)
to kidnap/to hijack/to abduct/to hold under duress
